headline: GOP women’s group rolls out seven-figure ad buy for Jane Timken in Ohio
author: Julia Manchester
sentences:
Timken released an ad last month touting her support for Trump while accusing the other challengers of being like men who “overcompensate.”
While Trump has yet to back someone in the primary, Timken received the biggest endorsement yet from retiring Sen.
Vance and former state Treasurer Josh Mandel have all openly jockeyed for Trump’s endorsement — and have received blowback from one another over claims of closeness to Trump.
The new ads paint Timken as a “Trump conservative” and an “America First conservative,” underscoring what has become a theme of the entire GOP primary.
The Republican group Winning for Women on Tuesday rolled out a seven-figure ad buy supporting Ohio Senate candidate Jane Timken ahead of May’s primary.
On Monday, Gibbons rolled out an ad tying himself to the former president and questioning Timken’s and Vance’s support for Trump.
The campaign will hit the television and radio airwaves for three weeks in the Columbus, Toledo, and Youngstown media markets.
The Hill has removed its comment section, as there are many other forums for readers to participate in the conversation.
Portman’s endorsement has been viewed as a boost for Timken, who has struggled to break into the upper tier of the race.
Many Ohio Republicans have wondered whether Portman’s endorsement could be a prelude to an endorsement from Trump.
The $1.4 million television, radio, digital and mail campaign marks the group’s first spending in the 2022 cycle.
